This game is great, good gameplay, fun progression, but... the absolute worst ranking and matchmaking imaginable. It could be my first game as a new killer at rank 15 and I will go against 4 red ranks all running meta perks, it's god awful. If you're gonna get this game, try to have some friends who play it to, because it will make you experience so much better.  Shout out to the homies who carry me through this game <3

Dogshit game with a dogshit community. I'll keep playing because its fun with friends, otherwise it is pretty toxic and frustrating 9 games out of 10. 

Reached rank 1 survivor in solo, still get braindead team mates that let you hit hook stage 2 on your first hook, or chase the killer to flashlight save someone who hasn't been hooked instead of healing their injured team mate. 

Don't even get me started on killers that yes, are simply playing the game, but tunnel survivors out so they don't even get to play the game. 

Killer is somehow more frustrating than playing survivor, since most survivors will seek out the killer for a more interactive game. I get it, gen-jockeying isn't exactly riveting gameplay. 

It would be nice if the devs  would give enough of a shit about the game to listen to the community instead of instituting brainless perk "changes" (read: nerfs). DS did not need a 2nd change/nerf, it works exactly as intended; killers can use their brains if they want to camp and tunnel. The Iron Will changes -- like, seriously? Nerf aggro perks, not stealth perks. Dead Hard change is fine, but that animation? Do we really need anymore evidence that the devs are fucking lazy? 

Give survivors more to do than fuck with the killer and jockey gens and you may find they... do more than just fuck with the killer. 

Meanwhile the things that ACTUALLY make playing killer frustrating have remained unchanged (if you're super tilted by DH sorry, but I have never found it that hard to wait out/mind game; still, I don't care about the change, I'm fine w. the endurance). 

I have close to 1200 hours in this game and while I agree there are definitely changes that can be made to improve the game quality for both survivors and killers, I don't think that the devs have any interest in instituting quality of life changes and really don't recommend anyone spending money on this game until it's playable without having a full stack.
Bug雖然多歸多，但好玩

Like any game, there's gonna be some rage and unfairness. Overall it hasn't stopped me from enjoying the game with my friends. It's fun to mix perks and change your play style to go with the challenges dbd offers. Balancing is slow and iffy, but I've hardly played any games that have been on the ball in that aspect. On sale this game is hardly expensive and if you have friends to play with I'd say it's worth the low price.
Excelente juego para jugar solo o con tus amigos, bastante dinamico y con muchas horas de juego y diversión.

Really love the game, fun to play as and against the killer with so many different perks, items, strategies, etc. There are no bugs (everything is a feature in this game and we know it). Somehow the optimization of this game is still worse than a PS2 game.

This game is unfair on both sides - This game doesn't need a balance patch, it needs a complete rework. Many perks are broken and map spawns excessively biased toward one side or the other. I do not recommend this game - While many games can be very unbalanced Dead by Daylight takes the cake.

Maybe you're thinking you want to try this game anyway. Let me give you some advice to make your experience less painful - Keep your rank low until you have all the perks that you want. Keeping your rank low means you can also complete your dailies much more easily. Let some players go here and there if you're playing the killer, or purposely allow yourself to be killed by the killer to prevent a rank up. Once you have all the perks you want you can descend into the toxic hell that is the single digit ranks. If you're not sure what perks to get, Google is your best friend.
